Internet Is Built On Waste

February 2010

Gerhard Gerken is the one who clearly sees how current economies are built on waste: every product created in the industrial era used more resources than value added.

Information economy is also built on waste. Today billions of electronic sub-products are created daily which are becoming waste tomorrow.

In contrast virtual products are not destroying the environment nor wasting the resources. Creators become more by letting the information flow through themselves.

The energy we are using to create and distribute information builds the internet.

No energies are lost at all. Only time is wasted sometimes â€¦ but procrastination drives the bursts, pushes the evolution ahead.

This essay is about technology. With focus on waste, the web, energy, resource, procrastination.
